entry.title: How Can You Protect Yourself on the Job?
entry.content:
Realtor safety is important to me, so here are a few tips to help you keep yourself safe on the job.

Schedule a Free Business Consultation

Realtor safety is a very important topic to me. Our office teaches Realtor safety classes from time to time, but here are a few safety pointers you should remember when working with a client.

First, be aware of your surroundings. For our agents, we recommend they meet their clients in our office first. If the client doesnâ€™t want to meet in the office, the second-best place is a public location like a coffee shop or a restaurant. If our agents donâ€™t feel comfortable with that person, we advise them to ask for some form of ID so we can take it to someone on our admin staff who can photocopy it.

If youâ€™ve never met a person before, you donâ€™t know what their motives or intentions are. We like to hope everyoneâ€™s intentions are honest and good, but itâ€™s better to be safe than sorry. Always ask a lot of questions before you meet a client, and remember that itâ€™s never a good idea to meet a client at a vacant property or meet at a property at night.
Ask a lot of questions before you meet with a client.
When showing a property, you want to meet your client at the property. Most safety experts recommend that you drive two different cars. There are some benefits to sharing the same car if you know the person, but if you donâ€™t, you should follow them from your office to the property in separate cars. Make sure youâ€™re aware of your situation before you get out of your car, especially if your client gets to the house before you do and you havenâ€™t met them yet.

When you list a home and youâ€™ve never met the client beforeâ€”perhaps they called you off the Internet or you were referred to them by someone you donâ€™t know eitherâ€”be careful. Once you get to the house and itâ€™s time to do your walkthrough, donâ€™t put yourself in certain situations like walking first down a basement stairway. Make sure the homeowner is always leading the way and youâ€™re just following. You always want to have an escape point in the house.

There are many neat apps and security devices you can get that will allow you to notify a loved one or law enforcement if you feel like youâ€™re in danger. You can also consider getting a taser, or if you prefer to carry a firearm, you can get a concealed carry permit.

If you have any questions about Realtor safety, please donâ€™t hesitate to reach out to me. Iâ€™d be happy to share the information that Iâ€™ve received with you or invite you to our next Realtor safety class. I look forward to hearing from you.

link.title: How Can You Protect Yourself on the Job?

entry.title: Why RE/MAX Millennium?
entry.content:
There are plenty of other real estate companies where you can hang your hat, so why join us here at RE/MAX Millennium? Letâ€™s start by talking about our motto.

A motto is a phrase, encapsulating the beliefs or ideals guiding an individual, family, or institution. Our Motto at RE/MAX Millennium sums up what we are about and why you are going to want to be here.

1) We always do what is right.
2) We put people first.
3) We hold people's names sacred.
4) We are teachable and always learning.
5) We have fun and laugh a lot.
6) We are grateful.
7) We are real and transparent.
8) We are one.

Here at RE/MAX Millennium, we are looking to drive change in the real estate industry and raise the bar. We will always be tweaking and evaluating those motto statements, but the heart will always remain the same.
 
Plan a visit so we can show you in person our motto!

What does a visit look like? You will get a tour of the office, meet the staff of RE/MAX Millennium, and meet with Jason to discuss what sets us apart and how we are different. We know you have so many options for your business and we know we might not be the a perfect fit for everyone, but we promise that you wonâ€™t be disappointed by simply finding out more.

We would love you to come and visit us to see if weâ€™re the right fit. As a bonus, we are waiving our $995 membership fee for the first 5 people who sign up with our team!  

Fill out your contact information here or reach out to us at (719) 999-8900 or JasonDaniels@remax.net to plan your visit! We look forward to hearing from you!
